code.name: CYBERNOIR
code.description: Step into a retro-noir inspired world of cybersecurity where participants become digital detectives. Solve puzzles, quizzes, and decode clues to unmask 'The Shadow'.
code.venue: Smart Classroom I, Sri Sairam Engineering College

rounds.name: Round 1
rounds.info: Quizzes, puzzles, riddles, and cipher texts based on cybersecurity concepts. Test awareness, logical reasoning, and curiosity.

rounds.name: Round 2
rounds.info: Detective-style mission solving interconnected challenges to reveal the true culprit 'The Shadow'.

code.instructions: Follow rounds sequentially. Bring your own devices. Valid college ID required. Full team presence mandatory. Time-bound submissions only.

code.name: Retro Code Chronicles
code.description: A coding challenge blending problem-solving, teamwork, and fun with unexpected hindrances.
code.venue: Alpha Hall, Sri Sairam Engineering College

rounds.name: Code Kickoff
rounds.info: Teams solve simple coding questions or MCQs online to shortlist top teams based on accuracy and speed. Only docs allowed; no collaboration.

rounds.name: Offline Semi-Finals – Logo Unlocked
rounds.info: Teams solve coding problems to reveal sections of a hidden logo and tackle bonus riddles. Only one coder active at a time; teamwork encouraged. Judges' decision final.

rounds.name: Offline Finale – Code Rush
rounds.info: Relay coding round with sequential coding turns and random funny hindrances every 15 seconds. Tests creativity, coding skills, teamwork, and composure.

code.instructions: Team size 3 members. Bring laptop & ethernet cable. Only one registration per team. Fair play mandatory; cheating leads to disqualification.

code.name: Vintage Webverse
code.description: A retro web design challenge testing teamwork, code quality, and accuracy across online and offline rounds.
code.venue: Beta Hall, Sri Sairam Engineering College

rounds.name: Online Prelims
rounds.info: Teams design retro-styled website components and submit a live link or GitHub repo. Judged based on accuracy, neatness, and code quality.

rounds.name: Prompt-O-Graph
rounds.info: One teammate views a vintage template and describes it to others. Team recreates the design within time limits. Tests teamwork and design precision.

rounds.name: Classic Remake
rounds.info: Teams analyze a website shown briefly, create a detailed prompt, and design it using multiple stacks. Final build deployed live to Netlify. Prompts must be clear and technically accurate.

code.instructions: Team size 2-3 members. Bring laptops and ethernet cables. Only one registration per team. Fair play mandatory. Follow time limits for submissions.

creative.name: Paper Powerhouse
creative.description: An engaging technical paper presentation competition designed to test research clarity, originality, adaptability, and presentation skills.
creative.venue: IEDC Cell, Sri Sai Ram Engineering College

rounds.name: Abstract & Concept Map Screening
rounds.info: Teams submit a five-page ppt highlighting problem, novelty, and outcomes, along with a concept map.

rounds.name: Academic Clash of Ideas
rounds.info: Stage 1: Shortlisted teams present their paper on stage (5-7 minutes). Stage 2: Interpret random visuals on spot. Stage 3: Make cross-domain connections and answer interactive questions from judges and audience.

creative.instructions: Abstracts must strictly adhere to page/word limits; plagiarism will lead to disqualification. All visual and cross-domain challenges in finals must be spontaneous. Strict time limits apply for each stage; exceeding limits leads to point deductions. Submissions after the deadline will not be accepted. Judges' decisions are final and binding.

creative.name: Past TO Profit
creative.description: Step into the high-stakes world of comeback artists by reviving failed startups and pitching innovative strategies creatively.

rounds.name: The Ad Sprint
rounds.info: Teams conceptualize and design a compelling poster or advertisement for fictional products in a 30-minute live Zoom session.

rounds.name: The Spotlight Showdown
rounds.info: Teams analyze failed startups, prep for 7 minutes, then deliver a 7-minute pitch. Must incorporate a mandatory 'Plot Twist' card and optionally solve a puzzle to discard it.

creative.instructions: Team size 2-3 members. College ID mandatory. Original ideas only. Late submissions not accepted. Judging based on creativity, innovation, adaptability, and presentation skills.

creative.name: The Golden Blueprint
creative.description: A UI/UX design challenge testing creativity, problem-solving, and design communication through poster campaigns and reverse designing.
creative.venue: Beta Hall, Sri Sairam Engineering College

rounds.name: Poster Campaign
rounds.info: Teams create a product poster within the time limit and upload to Google Drive, named after the team. Top teams qualify for offline rounds.

rounds.name: User Interface Creation
rounds.info: Teams design a UI incorporating a given mystery theme and problem statement. Completion of all pages required. Judges' decision final.

rounds.name: Reverse Designing Showdown
rounds.info: Teams decode abstract UI fragments into complete design solutions, present a 5-minute pitch, and defend in 3-minute Q&A. Judging based on originality, clarity, prototype quality, and communication.

creative.instructions: Team size 2-4 members. Follow time constraints. Use only provided materials for design. Judging final and binding.
